name: Shoyu Chicken
author: The Big E
summary: Shoyu Chicken is a popular Hawaiian dish. It is often served with rice. The word shoyu is Japanese for soy sauce. Let the chicken soak in the marinade for at least an hour, the longer the better.
directions: Whisk together the soy sauce, brown sugar, water, garlic, onion, ginger, black pepper, oregano, red pepper flakes, cayenne pepper, and paprika in a large glass or ceramic bowl
Add the chicken thighs, and toss to evenly coat
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, and lightly oil the grate
Remove the chicken thighs from the marinade
Grill the chicken thighs on the preheated grill until cooked through, about 15 minutes per side
